topics.title: Introduction
points: Fundamental for modern computing and internet
Involves protocols, hardware, and software components
Enables data sharing and resource access
Critical for distributed systems and cloud computing
Foundation for web development and applications

topics.title: Network Types
points: LAN (Local Area Network): Small geographic area
WAN (Wide Area Network): Large geographic area
VPN (Virtual Private Network): Secure remote access
Extranet: Network shared with external partners

topics.title: Network Topologies
topics.description: Physical and logical arrangement of network devices
points: Bus Topology: All devices connected to single cable
Star Topology: All devices connected to central hub
Ring Topology: Devices connected in circular fashion
Mesh Topology: Every device connected to every other device
Tree Topology: Hierarchical arrangement of devices
Hybrid Topology: Combination of different topologies
Point-to-Point: Direct connection between two devices
Point-to-Multipoint: One device connected to multiple devices

topics.title: OSI Model
points: Layer 7 - Application: User interfaces and applications
Layer 6 - Presentation: Data encryption, compression, translation
Layer 5 - Session: Establishes, manages, and terminates connections
Layer 4 - Transport: End-to-end communication, error recovery
Layer 3 - Network: Routing, logical addressing, path determination
Layer 2 - Data Link: Physical addressing, error detection
Layer 1 - Physical: Electrical, mechanical, functional specifications
Each layer communicates with corresponding layer on remote system

topics.title: TCP/IP Model
points: Application Layer: HTTP, FTP, SMTP, DNS protocols
Transport Layer: TCP (reliable) and UDP (unreliable) protocols
Internet Layer: IP, ICMP, ARP protocols
Network Access Layer: Physical and data link protocols

topics.title: IP Addressing
points: Public IP: Globally routable internet addresses
Private IP: Reserved for internal networks
Subnetting: Dividing networks into smaller subnets
NAT: Network Address Translation for private networks

topics.title: Protocols
points: DNS: Domain Name System for name resolution
UDP: User Datagram Protocol (unreliable but fast)

topics.title: Network Security
points: Firewalls: Control incoming and outgoing traffic
VPN: Secure remote access to private networks
Intrusion Detection: Monitor for security threats

topics.title: Wireless Networking
points: Security: WEP, WPA, WPA2, WPA3 protocols

topics.title: Network Devices
points: Switch: Connects devices within same network

topics.title: Troubleshooting
points: Common issues: DNS problems, connectivity issues

topics.title: Best Practices
points: Implement backup and disaster recovery plans
Train users on security best practices
